title: Lyft's Revenue Jumps 70% as Higher Fares Offset Fewer Riders
summary: Ride-hailing company says Omicron surge will likely affect revenue growth in the first quarter. Lyft Inc. said revenue increased 70% in the fourth quarter, as longer trips and higher fares offset weaker-than-expected ridership numbers.

title: The Message of Canada's Trucker Protest
summary: They are saying that it's time for the pandemic emergency orders to end.. Canadian truckers opposed to a Covid-19 vaccination mandate used their rigs on Monday to block the Ambassador Bridge connecting Windsor, Ontario, and Detroit, the busiest international land-border crossing in North America.

title: The IRS Does a Face Plant on Face Scans
summary: The tax agency scraps its biometric ID plan requirement to see personal records.. The Internal Revenue Service has walked back the biometrics security program we wrote about last week, and we're glad to hear it. But it's still worth addressing the flawed arguments that led to this face plant.

title: See No Labor, Hear No Labor
summary: Hourly workers fall off the government's radar as they shift from traditional payrolls to flexible apps.. More than six million people disappeared from the Labor Department's count of hourly paid workers between 2019 and 2021. They didn't just vanish. Many found ways of working that expose a blind spot in government policy while transforming the economy. They signed up for flexible working apps such as DoorDash , Amazon Flex, Trusted Health and the one from my company, Instawork-apps that match hourly workers with local businesses on a shift-by-shift or task-by-task basis.

title: Racial Gerrymanders at the Supreme Court
summary: Does the law command proportional representation by race?. The Supreme Court isn't above criticism, heaven knows, but it would be nice if the critics didn't accuse the Court of judgments it hasn't made. A case in point is the hyperventilating over the Court's 5-4 ruling Monday that stayed a lower-court order requiring Alabama's Congressional map to be redrawn in a few weeks (Merrill v. Milligan). The ruling did not rewrite the Voting Rights Act.

title: Second Gentleman Emhoff Ushered Out of Event After Threat to D.C. School
summary: Secret Service says there's no indication threat was directed toward husband of Vice President Kamala Harris. Second gentleman Doug Emhoff, the husband of Vice President Kamala Harris, was ushered out of an event Tuesday at Dunbar High School in Washington, D.C., after a security threat to the school, law-enforcement officials said.

title: Why There Aren't More Black Coaches in the NFL
summary: One reason is that teams don't want to hire someone they can't fire without being labeled racist.. Not long after Barack Obama became president, he made an appearance on the "Late Show With David Letterman." It was September 2009, and the administration's plans to overhaul the U.S. healthcare system had not been going over well in the polls. Some people, including former President Jimmy Carter, were insisting that criticism of Mr. Obama was racially motivated. Asked about it, Mr. Obama demurred. "It's important to remember," he said to Mr. Letterman, "that I was actually black before the election."

title: There's Apartheid in the Holy Land, but Not in Israel
summary: Palestinian law makes selling land to Jews a crime punishable by death, often without trial.. The report by Amnesty International accusing Israel of apartheid-a likely preview of similar moves at the United Nations and the International Criminal Court-has been widely debunked, including in these pages. Yet what is remarkable about its 200 pages of distortions is the evidence of real apartheid-like policies that Amnesty leaves out. There are reasons to be concerned about the emergence of apartheid in the Holy Land-but not the ones Amnesty cites.

title: Notable & Quotable: Will the GOP Get it Backward?
summary: 'Democrats want to talk about 2020 because they believe they can use it to defeat Republicans.'. Byron Yorkwriting for the Washington Examiner, Feb. 8:

title: U.S.-Canada Border Restrictions: What to Know About Crossing Requirements
summary: Fully vaccinated tourists can now cross the border in both directions. For more than 16 months, the U.S. and Canada turned away tourists at entry points across the 5,500-mile land border in an effort to contain further spread of Covid-19. On Aug. 9, Canada began allowing fully vaccinated Americans to enter the country again, and on Sept. 7, Canada expanded that reopening to include fully vaccinated visitors from other countries.

title: Macy's Aims RFID at Organized Retail Theft
summary: Radio-frequency identification chips provide insights into where, when and what items are being stolen, says Macy's vice president of asset protection. Amid a recent spate of high-profile thefts targeting retailers nationwide, Macy's Inc. said it is leaning on radio-frequency identification technology for asset protection.

title: House Passes Stopgap Measure Funding Government Through Mid-March
summary: Legislation moves to Senate as talks continue on long-term omnibus spending bill. WASHINGTON-The House passed legislation to keep the government funded through mid-March, advancing a temporary fix that will give negotiators time to reach a global agreement on fiscal 2022 spending after weeks of negotiations failed to yield a deal.

title: Joe Biden, a President for the New Cold War
summary: In one way, the 79-year-old NATO adherent is the right man for his times.. I've been waiting for some fragment of vindication after suggesting in 2019 that Joe Biden might be the "best we can do" in 2020.

title: 'Heiresses' Review: It Wasn't All Schiaparelli
summary: Wealthy women were once legally unprotected from predatory husbands who 'controlled their fortunes'-in every sense of the phrase.. According to Laura Thompson, the essence of the heiress's dilemma is: "How can she ever be sure that she is wanted for herself?" How can she avoid falling prey to a fortune-hunter as she yearns for love?

title: Joe Rogan vs. the Spotify Boycott
summary: Students discuss the controversy over the podcast star and his platform.. Editor's note: In this Future View, students discuss the Joe Rogan and Spotify controversy. Next week we'll ask, "So far, viewership of the Beijing Winter Olympics has been extremely low. Is this a reflection of a loss of interest in sports, a decline in identification with nation-states, or a judgment on the evils of the communist regime in China? Or is something else the cause of the collective yawn?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Feb. 15. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Bondholders for Troubled Aerospace Supplier Incora Hire Legal Counsel
summary: Akin Gump-represented group of bondholders seeks talks with company about how to restructure $2 billion of debt. Bondholders for airplane parts distributor Incora have hired a law firm to engage the company about how to restructure $2 billion of debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Peloton CEO to Step Down, Company to Cut 2,800 Jobs
summary: Exercise-equipment maker names former Spotify CFO Barry McCarthy as successor, changes board. Peloton Interactive Inc. is replacing its chief executive and cutting 2,800 jobs after a slowdown in demand caused the once-hot bike maker's value to plummet.

summary: Bidding is set to begin for rights to the Indian Premier League, a likely lure for India's sizable base of potential streaming subscribers. Some of the world's biggest media firms are preparing to do battle over a major prize in the global streaming wars: Indian cricket matches.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Hit Record Level in 2021
summary: Increase underscores strength of American economy as well as continued dependence on imports from China and other countries. The U.S. trade deficit increased 27% last year to an all-time high of $859.1 billion, underscoring the strength of the nation's economy and its continued hefty dependence on imports from China and other countries.

title: No, Your Peloton Instructor Isn't Getting Laid Off
summary: Fitness instructors, often social-media famous and viewed as brand ambassadors, elude company cutbacks. Peloton Interactive Inc . 's fitness instructors won't face layoffs amid the company's recent cutbacks as the exercise-equipment maker spared its brand ambassadors.

summary: They used to call it a swing state.. In recent years Republican voters have become more diverse and this trend has been so powerful in one big swing state that some Democrats are suddenly wondering if they should even bother competing there. Politico's Sabrina Rodriguez reports today:

title: 'The Girl Before' TV Review: House Rules
summary: A fancy yet affordable London flat comes with numerous stipulations for residents-and the watchful eye of its mysterious architect. The floor plan of "The Girl Before"-the latest in what now seems a hallowed tradition of imperiled-women miniseries on HBO-seems inevitable enough, maybe even overdue: the smart home as a haunted house. While it's not quite that simple in this four-part melodrama, the automated domicile does have its array of horror-movie accessories: disembodied voices; the sense of being watched; things that go bump-or worse-in the night. Have you ever seen Alexa? Me neither.

title: Bond Yields, Stocks Rise Amid Earnings
summary: Investors continue to sell government bonds in anticipation of interest-rate increases. Major U.S. stock indexes rose Tuesday as investors snapped up shares of companies across industries.

summary: Shift toward dividend-paying stocks is a bid for protection against a slowing economy, rising interest rates. Boring companies have been hot during the stock market's winter swoon.

summary: White House touts plans by Tritium DCFC as part of a wave of new plants to support EVs. WASHINGTON-Australia's Tritium DCFC Ltd. is planning to break ground this year on a Tennessee factory to build electric-vehicle charging stations, a development touted by the White House on Tuesday as part of a wave of new private-sector spending spurred by President Biden's infrastructure policy.

title: IRS's Struggles With Backlogs Draw Scrutiny From Lawmakers, Taxpayers
summary: The tax agency is reshuffling about 1,200 workers to help clear delayed refunds and correspondence. WASHINGTON-Lawmakers pressed for solutions to the Internal Revenue Service's paperwork backlog, which continues delaying millions of refunds from tax year 2020 and slowing taxpayers' ability to get answers from the government.

title: Vermont Is One Step Closer to Adding Abortion Rights to Its Constitution
summary: If voters approve constitutional amendment in November, it would make state first in U.S. to have such protections. Vermont lawmakers approved a state constitutional amendment on Tuesday enshrining abortion rights, the culmination of a yearslong legislative effort that could make the New England state the first in the U.S. with such protections.

title: Foreign Investment in U.S. Commercial Property Exceeds Pre-Pandemic Levels
summary: Overseas investors join domestic U.S. investors in focusing more on warehouses and rental apartments. Foreign investment in U.S. commercial property surpassed pre-pandemic levels last year, as overseas investors piled back in after travel restrictions eased and the U.S. economy bounced back.

title: The Best Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup Recipe Relies on One Simple Tool
summary: Yes, it all comes down to a sheet pan. Cook both soup and sandwich on that trusty kitchen multitasker, and a comforting meal is yours in no time.. IT IS A TRUTH universally acknowledged that grilled cheese and tomato soup is the quintessential comfort-food combo. So, the ideal recipe needs to be easy and leisurely, full stop. Enter the sheet pan. Yep, that hero of weeknight suppers is also the secret to prepping the world's lowest-effort soup and sandwich. The only other must-haves? A blender and some flexible pantry staples. From there, it's just broil, blend, crunch, slurp.

title: BlackRock Names Ed Fishwick as Risk Chief
summary: He succeeds BlackRock co-founder Ben Golub, who will transition to a senior advisory role at the money manager. BlackRock Inc. has named company insider Ed Fishwick as its chief risk officer, according to an employee memo viewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: 'Saturday Night Live' Alum David Spade Gets $19.5 Million for Beverly Hills Home
summary: The Trousdale Estates home was listed a month ago for just under $20 million, got multiple offers. Comedian David Spade has sold his longtime Beverly Hills home for $19.5 million, just a month after listing it for $19.995 million.

title: Take a Hike (Wednesday Crossword, February 9)
How to Keep Up in the Economic Arms Race?
summary: Semiconductors, free-market principles and the allure of control.. Regarding your editorial "The Be More Like China Act" (Feb. 3): In the 1980s, the accepted wisdom was that Japan was going to take over everything. The Ministry of International Trade and Industry (MITI) was a government agency that effectively directed Japanese companies. U.S. politicians wanted to emulate MITI's great success. Not much later, Japan entered a decadeslong recession.

title: The Pro-Life Case Against Robert Califf for the FDA
summary: President Biden's nominee caters to the abortion industry and the most extreme voices in his party.. Your editorial "Robert Califf for the FDA" (Jan. 31) unfairly dismissed well-documented pro-life and public-health concerns with President Biden's nominee. While serving as commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration under President Obama, Dr. Califf authorized the weakening of data reporting requirements on medical complications that result from chemical abortions, obscuring the real dangers these drugs pose to women and girls.

title: Some Things in Life Are Bigger Than Politics
summary: The formula to move through these challenging times: resilience, compassion, humility, appreciation and responsibility.. Thanks and condolences to Karl Rove for his heartfelt article on his sister's passing as a result of Covid-19 ("Requiescat in Pace, Alma," op-ed, Feb. 3). I am heartened that Mr. Rove did not make her passing a political incrimination of anyone. What we don't know about life and medicine remains a mystery, but family is our ultimate solace. Thank you, Mr. Rove for reminding us of that truth.

title: What's Going On With CUNY's Woke Union?
summary: The Professional Staff Congress representing faculty and staff denounces Israel but won't say a peep about China.. I am a retired City University of New York employee and former Professional Staff Congress (PSC) grievance counselor, representing employees in labor disputes with CUNY. I am familiar with the statements from Avraham Goldstein's op-ed "I'm Stuck With an Anti-Semitic Labor Union" (Jan. 21), and I found Prof. Goldstein's criticism of the PSC quite restrained.

title: With Covid, Stop Treating Children Like the Enemy
summary: The schools need to give them their best chance at a healthy future.. Thank you, Dr. Eran Bendavid, for saying what we are thinking ("Covid and the 'Hygiene Hypothesis,'" op-ed, Feb. 2). As a mother and grandmother, I am beyond frustrated with the mask mandates in schools. Where is the balance? My father (who lived to 94) always said, "everything in moderation." The teachers unions and the CDC need to stop treating children like the enemy. They are the hope of the future, and they need to be given their best chance at a healthy one.

title: Pfizer Forecasts $54 Billion in 2022 Sales From Covid Vaccine, Treatment
summary: Drugmaker in search for deals to boost pipeline of products. As Pfizer Inc. forecasts strong sales this year for its Covid-19 vaccine and treatment, the drugmaker is on the hunt for deals to bolster its pipeline of experimental products.

title: Which Houseplants Are Best in Bathrooms?
summary: Horticulture pros suggest five beauties that suit the moisture and low light of most bathroom biospheres. PLANTS ARE already a go-to decorating tool. Whether it's an erupting schefflera that offsets a boxy sofa or an ivy that softens the doldrums of a desk, they bring a much-needed living element to décor. So why not extend that soul-soothing effect by adding foliage to a bathroom, a habitat particularly hospitable to flora? "The humidity [of the bathroom] makes it the most greenhouse-like portion of a home," said Christopher Satch, professor at the New York Botanical Garden and a botanist with Horti, a houseplant subscription service based in Brooklyn. Well-suited to thrive in a loo are tropical plants known as epiphytes-orchids, ferns and air plants among them-that in the forest grow within the tree canopy. Unlike terrestrial types, such as a spider plant, these gather nutrients and drink up the water droplets from the air.

title: Pro-China Twitter Accounts Flood Hashtag Critical of Beijing Winter Olympics
summary: Researchers say many accounts are largely automated and are meant to drown out calls by advocacy groups to boycott the Beijing Games. Pro-China accounts have been flooding Twitter with messages that include the hashtag #GenocideGames, in what researchers say is an effort to dilute the hashtag's power to galvanize criticism of the Winter Olympics host nation.

title: The Full List of Oscars Nominees
summary: 'The Power of the Dog' leads with 12 nominations, followed by 'Dune' and 'Belfast'. "The Power of the Dog" scored 12 Oscar nominations and the sci-fi epic "Dune" earned 10. Additionally, period drama "Belfast" and Steven Spielberg's update of "West Side Story" received seven nominations each.

title: The New Axis of Autocracy
summary: Germany and France are weak links as the West faces an alliance of China and Russia.. The Feb. 4 meeting in Beijing between Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping makes it official: The U.S. and its allies now face an axis of autocracy stretching from the Baltic to the Pacific.

summary: Physicians, losing patience with their patients, forget their obligation to care.. Doctors are increasingly refusing to treat the unvaccinated. A Texas task force has considered reserving beds in intensive-care units solely for the vaccinated.

title: Retired Pope Benedict XVI Asks for Forgiveness Over Handling of Sex-Abuse Cases
summary: Benedict fights to defend his record after report criticized failings during his time as an archbishop. ROME-Retired Pope Benedict XVI replied to charges that he mishandled cases of clerical sexual abuse during his tenure as an archbishop in Germany, but his response seemed unlikely to remove the taint that the allegations have left on his record.

title: Covid-19 Relief Funds Drive Up Nurse Pay, Hospitals Say
summary: Federal funding contributes to huge wage gains amid healthcare labor shortage. Hospitals and lawmakers are pressing the Biden administration to review federal pandemic-relief programs that they say have distorted pay rates for travel nurses.

title: What's Happening With Joe Rogan and Spotify
summary: As Joe Rogan faces scrutiny surrounding past uses of racial slurs, here's what to know about the podcaster and Spotify's response. Joe Rogan has been facing public scrutiny for his past use of racial slurs. On Feb. 5, Mr. Rogan apologized after a compilation video emerged showing how he and some of his guests used the N-word numerous times on his show. On Feb. 6, Spotify Chief Executive Daniel Ek apologized to employees for the way Mr. Rogan's use of the slur in previous podcast episodes has impacted them.

title: Europe Aims to Boost Microchip Output With Billions in New Funding

title: Maybe Your Dog Needs a Valentine's Day Gift
summary: From brands like Hermès and Alessi, the upscale pet's Valentine's Day gift for 2022. Wouldn't it be nice to give a Valentine's Day gift to someone with no expectations? Who's not, say, secretly pining for a diamond necklace as you present them a beef-jerky subscription box? Who's not going to look distrustfully at your packing-tape-inclusive wrapping job? Who's not doing the dishes extra loudly upon sight of those bent 7-Eleven carnations? Presenting eight Valentine's Day 2022 gifts for a neglected cohort on this holiday-your pet, or the family member most likely to be equally thrilled with the gift, the discarded packaging and the human behind it all. (And to whom, we're quite sure, a beef-jerky subscription box would go down pretty well.) WSJ. Magazine's editors select:

title: 14 Neutral Looks That Are Anything But Boring
summary: This season, discover new ways to translate khaki shades into smart styles.. Fashion's favorite spring neutral-khaki-got a major upgrade this season, driven by new styles from brands such as Prada, Miu Miu and Givenchy, which offered it up as everything from structured bustiers to pale paper-like dresses. Beige cotton drill, a fabric typically associated with vintage wartime attire, workwear and school uniforms, has now been reintroduced in new shapes that range from sexy to austere. A strapless belted minidress with cargo pockets from Hedi Slimane at Celine resembles a uniform even a Girl Scout would approve of. Childhood chinos have graduated to sultry crop tops and box-pleat ultra-mini skirts at Miu Miu. A boiler suit from Isabel Marant, here worn open at the top with a Salvatore Ferragamo bra and a pair of sleek black Manolo Blahnik mules, even transforms traditional workwear into an evening-appropriate ensemble. The season is also full of new versions of tan gabardine trench coats. If you're unable to choose just one, layering two from The Row adds luxuriously effortless texture. Don't worry about doubling up-mixing khaki pieces is a move that will never fail. -Jenny Hartman

title: What Does Men's Business Casual Look Like Now?
summary: Now that WFH has relaxed dress workday codes, must guys obey old style rules as they trickle back to the office? And how much of their comfy home-office wardrobe can go with them? The rules governing workplace attire were already relaxing pre-Covid; throw in two years of Zoom calls and a universal acclimation to comfy outfits, and the once-standard "business casual" dress-code has become problematically hazy.

title: The Freak Rain Storms That Saved a Los Angeles Super Bowl
summary: SoFi Stadium, the host of Super Bowl LVI, was supposed to host the game a year earlier-when fans would have been barred because of the pandemic. title: Apparel Brands' Rally Hangs by a Thread
summary: Clothing brands face the daunting task of surpassing last year's strong sales and margins, which were driven by unusual circumstances. Vietnam factory shutdowns and supply chain snags notwithstanding, apparel companies emerged from the pandemic looking sharp. How long can they keep it up?

title: Covid-19 Restrictions Unwind as Omicron Wanes in U.S., Parts of Europe
summary: Deaths from disease remain little changed, adding to evidence that latest virus wave is ebbing. The downturn in Covid-19 cases in the U.S. continued at the start of the week, while deaths of people diagnosed with the disease remained little changed, adding to evidence that the surge caused by the Omicron variant of the virus is receding.

title: Profitable Companies Enlist Bankruptcy Courts to Sidestep Cancer Trials
summary: Corporations facing unwieldy asbestos litigation are accessing the benefits of bankruptcy without filing chapter 11 themselves. A handful of large, profitable corporations are using a new strategy to access U.S. bankruptcy courts, unlocking powerful legal tools for settling thousands of asbestos lawsuits for a fraction of what juries might force these companies to pay.

title: Traders Struggle to Value Trump's Social-Media Company
summary: Schism has emerged between shares and warrants of blank-check company taking former president's firm public. Traders are struggling to place a consistent value on Donald Trump's new social-media venture, a business that hasn't offered much in the way of details but one that supporters think is destined to take off.

title: Putin Says the West Is Goading Russia Into War-and Many Russians Agree
summary: Resume Subscription. Like many Russians, graduate student Anastasia Bukhteyeva hopes the current standoff between Russia and the West over Ukraine doesn't erupt into a full-scale war.

title: VF Works to Lock In Inventory Early as Supply-Chain Issues Linger
summary: The apparel and footwear company said it is pulling forward commitments to suppliers by a few weeks on average. VF Corp. , the owner of apparel brands such as the North Face, Vans and Supreme, is agreeing to buy raw materials earlier than usual amid lingering supply-chain pressures.

title: Eileen Gu's Olympics Begin With Gold in Big Air-and Citizenship Questions
summary: The U.S.-born freestyle skiing star competing for China landed a huge trick on her final run to win the first of three events she'll contest at these Games. BEIJING-A surprise gold medal by Eileen Gu, the U.S.-born freestyle skier competing for her mother's homeland of China, set off jubilation in the Chinese public but spurred renewed questions about her citizenship status.

title: The Most Interesting Man in Figure Skating's Most Incredible Olympic Saga
summary: A seemingly impossible race across airports and time zones to compete in Beijing is about as normal as life gets for Keegan Messing. Canadian figure skater Keegan Messing lives in the wilderness of Alaska, where he built his own backyard rink and has been known to use a chain saw for weight training.

title: Macron Meets With Putin as France Tries to Flex Diplomatic Muscle Over Ukraine
summary: French president is also going to Kyiv, and Biden met with Germany's leader. President Biden said Monday that the Nord Stream 2 pipeline to deliver Russian natural gas to Germany won't go forward if Russia invades Ukraine, stepping up pressure to isolate Moscow as French President Emmanuel Macron kicked off a round of shuttle diplomacy aimed at thawing tensions between the Kremlin and the West.

title: Nathan Chen Smashed His Short Program. Up Next: A Gold Medal?
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIJING-It began with Nathan Chen resting his hand on his heart with four years of Olympic pressure on his shoulders. It ended with a triumphant fist pump.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Biden Says Nord Stream 2 Pipeline Won't Go Forward if Russia Invades Ukraine
summary: President made the comment during joint press conference with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. President Biden said the Russian-built Nord Stream 2 natural-gas pipeline to Germany would be suspended if Russia invades Ukraine, with the German chancellor offering support but without explicitly saying the project would be halted.

title: Biden's Science Adviser Quits Over Behavior Toward Staff
summary: A White House investigation found he demeaned staff in violation of workplace-behavior rules. WASHINGTON-President Biden's top science adviser resigned after an internal White House investigation found that he demeaned staff in violation of the administration's workplace-behavior rules.

title: U.S. Bars Former Honduran President Hernández From Entry
summary: State Department cites reports of Juan Orlando Hernández being involved in corruption and illicit campaign financing. The U.S. government barred former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández from entering the country, and made the decision public as it seeks to improve ties with the Central American country as part of efforts to curb migration to the U.S.

title: Chinese Authorities Trace Origins of Chained Woman After Footage Stirs Online Anger
summary: Questions remain over how 'Little Plum Blossom' came to marry a man nearly 2,000 miles from her home. Authorities in an eastern corner of China where video footage recently emerged of a mother of eight chained in a shed said they have traced the origins of the woman to a village in China's south.

title: U.S. Agrees to Lift Trump-Era Tariffs on Japanese Steel
summary: The agreement removes a longstanding irritant between the two allies. WASHINGTON-The U.S. said Monday it has agreed to lift import tariffs on Japanese steel imposed by the Trump administration, removing a longstanding irritant in the bilateral relations between the two allies.

title: House Passes Bill to Bar Mandatory Arbitration in Cases of Sexual Assault and Harassment
summary: The measure now heads to the Senate where it's expected to pass with bipartisan support. WASHINGTON-The House passed a bipartisan bill that would bar mandatory arbitration in cases of sexual assault and harassment, and the Senate could take it up as soon as this week, as the legislation moves closer to becoming law.

title: Former Bank Executive Sentenced to a Year in Case Tied to Manafort Loans
summary: Stephen Calk sought Trump administration job while bank loans were pending. A former bank executive was sentenced Monday to a year and a day in prison for corruptly arranging $16 million in loans to former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort in an effort to obtain a high-ranking government job.

title: Guess Investor Wants Marcianos Out
summary: Activist investor argues sexual-misconduct allegations threaten turnaround efforts. An activist investor is calling for the co-founders of Guess Inc. to be removed from the clothing maker's board, arguing that sexual-misconduct allegations against one of the men threaten its turnaround efforts.

title: Sensor Maker Velodyne Lidar's Shares Surge After Amazon Investment
summary: Stock jumps in extended-hours trading after company issues warrant to tech giant to buy nearly 40 million shares. Velodyne Lidar Inc.'s stock jumped more than 50% in extended-hours trading Monday after the maker of sensors for autonomous cars reported an investment by Amazon.com Inc.

title: Minnesota to Review Shooting Death of Amir Locke
summary: State's attorney general to review police shooting of 22-year-old Black man as they executed search warrant. Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey ordered a moratorium on no-knock warrants in the city after a Black man was fatally shot by Minneapolis police inside his apartment early Wednesday.

title: China-Based Hytera Charged With Stealing Trade Secrets From Motorola Solutions
summary: U.S. prosecutors allege that Hytera got Motorola Solutions employees to steal proprietary digital mobile radio technology. A U.S. indictment alleges a China-based telecommunications company conspired to steal digital mobile radio technology developed by Motorola Solutions Inc.

title: Texas Church-Shooting Survivors, Families Awarded More Than $230 Million From U.S. Government
summary: Judge previously found the Air Force mostly responsible for the Sutherland Springs shooting in which 26 died. The U.S. government must pay just over $230 million to the survivors and families of victims of a 2017 mass shooting at a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, a federal judge ruled Monday.

title: Several States Lift Mask Mandates
summary: Connecticut, New Jersey, California among those aiming to ease mask mandates in public places as Omicron surge subsides. Officials in several Democrat-led states said Monday they would lift mask mandates for schools or other indoor areas in coming weeks as Covid-19 cases fall.

title: Justices Allow Alabama Congressional Map for Now
summary: Republican-drawn map will remain in place while justices hear the case in full. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court Monday granted Alabama's request to reinstate its electoral map that has produced a House delegation of six white Republicans and one Black Democrat, temporarily blocking a lower-court order that found the state's map disadvantages Black voters.
